intro: Lellingeria antillensis, commonly known as the West Indian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture. It is often found in coastal hammocks and moist forests, where it thrives in the humid climate. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native habitat.
